property.name: text
property.value: (Set this parameter to BerkeleyPolicy.xml for a different request policy.)

property.name: text
property.value: This model simulates the car and pedestrian traffic at a 4-way intersection. The car lights function according to the dynamically changed green, red and yellow durations, until a pedestrian arrives at any pedestrian light and presses the request button. The Berkeley policy is to serve the pedestrian immediately. The Manhattan policy, on the contrary, completely ignores pedestrian requests. This model features heterogeneous multi-modeling. Models of computation, such as DE (discrete-event), Ptera (Ptolemy event relationship actor), Wireless, SDF (synchronous dataflow) and FSM (finite state machine), are used at different levels of the model hierarchy for maximum design flexibility. Another highlight is the use of model transformation with Ptera controllers. Specifically, PeriodController is a component that changes the car and pedestrian arrival rates dynamically according to the intersection specification. DurationController monitors the number of waiting cars and the number of waiting pedestrians, and increases or decreases the green durations if the two numbers become too far apart.

property.name: text
property.value: Christopher Brooks, Thomas Huining Feng, Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value: (A demo of the LMATL Naomi project)

property.name: actions
property.value: IncreaseNS = (Intersection.CarCountN - Intersection.PedCountN) + (Intersection.CarCountS - Intersection.PedCountS) > Threshold; DecreaseNS = (Intersection.CarCountN - Intersection.PedCountN) + (Intersection.CarCountS - Intersection.PedCountS) < -Threshold; IncreaseEW = (Intersection.CarCountE - Intersection.PedCountE) + (Intersection.CarCountW - Intersection.PedCountW) > Threshold; DecreaseEW = (Intersection.CarCountE - Intersection.PedCountE) + (Intersection.CarCountW - Intersection.PedCountW) < -Threshold
